intro: Kelleria tasmanica, commonly known as the Tasmanian kelleria, is a flowering plant native to the south-eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, recurved leaves and showy, pinkish-white inflorescences. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands. It produces small, clustered flowers that attract nectar-feeding birds and insects. Kelleria tasmanica is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in the ecological diversity of its native habitat.
